website_summaries.verdict: We love this olive pitter for its expanded capacity and convenient bottom compartment, making it easy to pit olives and other seeded fruits.
pros: Pits or seeds are automatically caught in the bottom compartment, making cleanup easy
Has large capacity to handle 6 olives at a time, which is great if you’re looking to remove pits in bulk
Made of durable materials and easy to use
cons: May leave some pits in olives if not lined up properly

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this. We go through a lot of cherries ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this. We go through a lot of cherries in the summer and pitting them is the pits. But maybe less is more in this instance. I found that you have to perfectly situate the cherry to get the most success from the device. And even then, it only gets about 4 of the 6. So then you’re left having to move around a cherry that’s been punctured and messy to try and find the pit. A single-pitter seems like it would take longer but it really doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Caiapfas

customer_reviews.title: Great for pitting lots of cherries
customer_reviews.text: Great way to pit all those cherries. I'm crazy for cherries and buy a ton every year during the season. Luckily, I live in Washington State so cherries are readily available and reasonable. This year I froze at least 20 lbs of cherries. We'll be having pies, crisps, scones, and anything else I can think of during the cold winter. Hope I have enough to last till next season. I took away one star because the locking device that keeps this closed when not in use broke. I now use a heavy duty rubber band to keep it closed. The metal pitters are VERY sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact Design, Easier to Press Than Some Other Cherry Pitters
customer_reviews.text: DESIGN Compact design was great for storage since we only pull it out once a year. EASE OF PRESSING It took some strength, but my child could actually do it. ACCURACY This cherry pitter missed a few pits, but handled bigger cherries and smaller cherries equally well.
customer_reviews.author: becker

customer_reviews.title: This product works great
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a "one at a time" plunger type pitter but it took quite awhile to pit cherries for jam and it broke after only two seasons. Also I had to double check nearly every cherry to make sure the pit was actually removed. This pitter takes out 6 pits at a time and has a much higher success rate in removing the pits. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars across the board is that it seems a little flimsy and will probably break with a lot of use. Still, for the money it is well worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Evensen

customer_reviews.title: Used once and it broke!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and most were positive, my experience is different. I’ve had this for about a month before I used it. First time I used it, it worked perfectly. I hand washed it and put it away. I took it out to use and it had warped. Now it’s unusable and I’ve wasted my money. There are other cherry pitters on the market and I can’t recommend this one in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine M. Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Great Accuracy. Perfect for Kids and Elderly, and Travel.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy. I can pit 2 pounds in under 5 minutes. Be careful when washing. Metal pieces are sharp. Otherwise, easy to clean. I'd give it 95% accuracy. Periodically misses a pit, but definitely not often. I turn each cherry over as I remove them to be sure the hole was punched all the way through. Creates convenience to avoid having a nasty container to spit seeds into. Especially great if you have children (avoid clicking hazard) or care for an older adult. Compact design for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Just AZK

customer_reviews.title: Cherry Pitter Great idea
customer_reviews.text: I really like this item, the only downfall is that most of the pits hang from the cherries--they don't always drop in the tray. So I had to open the pitter and pull down the hanging pits. Other than that, it's still quicker than doing them by hand or one at a time with a one at a time pitter. I typically do the six cherries at a time, then empty the tray after EACH load of 6 cherries so I don't miss any pits. I hope this makes sense. It's hard to explain without actually seeing this in action.
customer_reviews.author: Cora Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Quick, pits every cherry, no mess, dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest kitchen tool I’ve bought in the last 10 years! You put five cherries in at one time and it pushes out the seed on every cherry! The seeds pop into the tray below. The best part is that it has a large paddle that is easy to push down. Arthritis makes some tools impossible to use. With this great cherry pitter you’ll have enough cherries to make a pie in no time! I'm looking for more cherry recipes since I can put 25-30 cherries in a few minutes!!
customer_reviews.author: Santa_Cruz_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fast but need to double check each cherry
customer_reviews.text: Great little cherry pitter! I can have a bag of 🍒 done quickly. I have found a few pits still left in the cherries, so I have to check each one individually by sticking my finger inside each one before putting into the bowl. I also found it works better when I place the stem side up. The clip that holds it closed broke off the first day of use. Easy to clean in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Jensen

customer_reviews.title: BEST cherry pitter on the market!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the negative reviews on this cherry pitter and trying it out for myself, I felt compelled to write a review. This is hands down the best cherry pitter I've worked with. I believe the trick is to place the cherries upright with the hole where the stem was facing upwards. This got the pits out of the cherries 100% of the time. I'm not kidding. It didn't miss a single pit. And six at a time?! Bonus. You will never have to eat a single cherry with a pit ever again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Meh.. doesn't make life easier
customer_reviews.text: Not a good purchase, returned it right away. it was very tough to push the cherries through. you had to get the seeds aligned just perfectly every time for the little metals to push through it. Good in thought, not in theory.
customer_reviews.author: Leezy

customer_reviews.title: Pittless fresh cherries? Where did you find them?
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I do suggest counting the pits every time you push them out, and discard them. Was making a large fruit salad for daughters open house graduation. Did about 4lbs of cherries about 3 of the pits out of all those the pit tried to hide. But the crowd loved having fresh Michigan cherries in a fresh fruit salad. And many were amazed about "pittless" cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy4527

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1st Time used
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism fell apart the very 1st time I used it, so disappointed especially since this was on the Amazon choice list. I was trying to avoid the single pit one but should have gone that route to get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo 21

customer_reviews.title: Too much trouble for me.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good idea, but you have to position the cherries, and then check them to make sure the pit came out. I’ll stick with a single putter.
customer_reviews.author: RCT

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Cherry Pitter
customer_reviews.text: I was told by a friend that this cherry pitter does a wonderful job. I ordered it and I absolutely agree. The pits come out cleanly into a tray. Cleaning is easy, I just rinse it off as soon as I'm done with it and it comes away clean. I recommend this if you're looking for an easy way to pit cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Shebamomus

customer_reviews.title: What a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to pit several large bags of cherries in no time flat. I double checked the cherries afterwards and only had a few seeds, which didn't extract. No issue tough. Just made a fabulous cherry pie. This is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: bargain shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing does exactly what it advertises. Product delivers. Cherries were left whole while the seeds were pushed into the smaller container at the bottom. The pitters are very sharp. I'm super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy LawGirl

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about this earlier!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use if you place the cherries stem side up after taking off the stem, you can easily push down and the seeds come out. When I think about how many times I struggled with my single seeder just because I did not know about this item.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C Kain

customer_reviews.title: This pitter is sturdy and solid and will pit a ton of cherries ...
customer_reviews.text: This pitter is sturdy and solid and will pit a ton of cherries in a jif, but it tends to leave the pit in the cherry for larger cherries. When it works perfectly, all 6 cherry pits are removed from the cherries and end up in the catch basin below the cherries, but for larger cherries, the pit is broken free from the cherry, but remains inside the cherry. So be careful to make sure each cherry pit is completely removed. Also, the catch basin at the bottom is a little smaller than I would like. It's not horrible, but my mom has the 4-cherry pitter and hers has a larger basin and seems to handle the larger cherries better.
customer_reviews.author: sweetmama

customer_reviews.title: An exceptional and easy cherry pitter.
customer_reviews.text: This cherry pitter is extraordinary. I read the excellent review at America's Test Kitchen for the 4 cherry version of this pitter. When I saw the 6 cherry version was basically the same only larger, I decided to purchase it. I just pitted 2 cups of cherries in a very short period of time with no mess. You need to hold the base firmly and give the top 1-2 punches as if you were stapling a large document. With 2 punches, all were pitted. With this pitter, I am now encouraged to take on more recipes with cherries. Cleanup is a breeze! Thanks Prepworks for this exceptional pitter!!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cherry pitter. I'm a cherryholic and find chewing around the pit to be a nuisance. This thing pitted 12 cherries in about 10 seconds. Love it and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Fast efficient amazing
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this product. I usually have to but otter frozen cherries for my Greek yogurt or hand pit each one. This worked great! It was fast and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof3

customer_reviews.title: Cherry Pitter from Progressive International
customer_reviews.text: I ordered because I was tired of pitting cherries one at a time. So I looked at the offerings on Amazon and compared reviews and pricing and decided to buy this one from Progressive Int'l. It's amazing and easy to use. It gets all six pits almost every time. I would recommend this pitter to anyone looking to buy one. The other thing I like is how easy it is to clean. It comes apart easily and you just toss the pits and rinse it off in the sink...done. If it ever breaks, I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: jwscott23

customer_reviews.title: a great invention!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy way to pit cherries! I was very happy to use this cherry pitter. Works like a champ!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Makes prepping fresh cherries so much faster & easier!
customer_reviews.text: I prep lots of fresh fruit to freeze in various recipes for smoothies in bursts & love fresh cherries in season. Pitting 3 lbs of cherries in one sitting... 1 at a time? Not so much. This really did an excellent job in 1/5 the time. I can fill it/pit 6 cherries at a time and reload 3 or 4 times before emptying the pit catcher side. Easy to clean as tray is removable. Easy to store thanks to hinge lock.
customer_reviews.author: MxE

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, not good construction
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept but never got to use it once. It literally fell apart before I even used it. The seller was great and sent a return label right away so hopefully the one I received was just a fluke. Hoping for better results when my return comes.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Price

customer_reviews.title: Sensibly designed
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous! Over many long years I've had a wide variety of cherry stoners, but this is the best, because it's easy to tell if you missed any pits by counting what's in the collection tray. Also it has a 6 cherry capacity. I once had one that squeezed the pits out fast, but missed a lot and about the only way to know was to bite down on one. That made eating a cherry pie a real adventure. But 6 at a time is faster then most, so this is my favorite one so far!
customer_reviews.author: GRANNY

customer_reviews.title: No more red fingers!
customer_reviews.text: No more red fingers! My kids love cherries but hate the pits. Every year I have considered buying a cherry pitter but then refrained thinking, "Seriously? You're so lazy you can't pit some cherries?" I wish I had bought this sooner. It doesn't work perfectly every time, but it makes it easy to identify which cherries still have pits. And it does 6 at a time. I would totally buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Accurately extracts cherries 4 out of 5 times.  Large cherries can cause problems.
customer_reviews.text: No Cherry pitter is going extract the pit every time, but this one does a good job. I would say it extracts pits 4 out of 5 times. The only downside is that if your cherries are large, it had less accuracy. With large cherries, it only will get about 2 of 5. To solve this problem, I put only one large cherry in the middle hole of the pitter, and the accuracy goes back up to 4 out of 5 times.
customer_reviews.author: rabbit rabbit

customer_reviews.title: saves time
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a pitter that only did 1 cherry at a time Now when I buy a couple of pounds of cherries I'm done in no time
customer_reviews.author: katibelle

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Pit cherries with ease -- you will no longer look like you just walked away from a murder scene LOL! Seriously, though, this is easy to use and cleanup for eating cherries whole or in preparation for baking.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M.

customer_reviews.title: Parts were missing.
customer_reviews.text: When I finally got around to using the cherry pitter, I discovered that it will not remove the pits from 6 cherries. It will only remove the pits from 4 cherries. Two of the metal blades that remove the pits are missing. I'm not impressed with this gadget
customer_reviews.author: S. Leinart

customer_reviews.title: Love this cherry pitter.
customer_reviews.text: Love this cherry pitter. Haven't tried on olives yet, but I pitted a whole pound without emptying the tray. It doesn't matter how you put them in; pit removed every time. One or two in a pound had a small piece of pit in it, so you still need to take that first bite gently, but it works great and cleanup is fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 77

customer_reviews.title: It's the Pits!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! No more pesky pits in my way of fist pounding cherries in my pie hole!
customer_reviews.author: B. Horton

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I can cruise through a ton of cherries with this pitter. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Y. Tomechko

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Great product, pitted five libs of cherries. It was so easy and the pitter is durable. Would suggest purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. We can make cherry drinks and pies fast now.
customer_reviews.author: Mandeep Amar Singh

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and ease of cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this pitter. It is easy to use and makes short work of pitting, I did 10 lbs in practically no time. However, when taking the pitted cherries out of the unit, be sure to check that all the seeds came out. Every now and again, a few did not drop out and remained in the cherry body.
customer_reviews.author: Don R.

customer_reviews.title: Cherry chomping game changer
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing! Easy to use on my cherries. Don’t know how I’ve survived this long without a cherry pitter. Take the stems off, pop in the little circle and squeeze down on the handle. Same as other reviews,might want to count the pits because sometimes they don’t come out.
customer_reviews.author: jude

customer_reviews.title: This tool is great, fits 6 at a time
customer_reviews.text: I used to pit cherries, one at a time by hand and ended up making a mess and having red fingers. This tool is great, fits 6 at a time, doesn't take any effort to press down on it and in a second, you have pitted cherries. I haven't had a problem with it not working and worrying about it not pitting every cherry. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sirius Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: This Is Not The Pits :)
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is great. It pits 6 cherries at one time. Some times the pit doesn't come all the way out. That's not a problem. I check the tray after pitting and count how many pits are there. Empty the tray and do it again. It's best if you put the cherry in stem side up. Now I can buy cherries on sale and not just eat them. I have a bunch in the freezer for later use.
customer_reviews.author: TJinSA

customer_reviews.title: Was a sceptic but it works!
customer_reviews.text: It is great to pit my cherries and pack them in my lunch. I absolutely recommend it. It seems very durable. I waited a few months to post this and I’m still using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Online consumer

customer_reviews.title: It works great and is super useful
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it does. It works great and is super useful. I love to eat cherries in bunches and I hate going back and spitting the seed out and picking up another cherry. I love it pitted so I can stuff 3 or 4 in my mouth and just enjoy! It did take some time to arrive though, it was within the predicted shipping period
customer_reviews.author: andrew2015

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. For some reason, the same prong misses the cherry pit everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ! A must have
customer_reviews.text: So awesome ! Easy to clean - fast way to pit cherries. The best
customer_reviews.author: Benzgirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, saves time.
customer_reviews.text: This made pitting cherries a breeze and a lot less messy, and I had a lot of cherries to pit. The plastic on the outer covering arrived with part of it broken off but it didn’t seem to affect the product. We will just try to glue it.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Having a pitter that does 6 at a time was AWESOME! I purchased two so that my 6 yo ...
customer_reviews.text: This year we picked 30 lbs of cherries. Having a pitter that does 6 at a time was AWESOME! I purchased two so that my 6 yo and 4 yo could help me pit cherries. They loved it! It does take some strength to do 6, but once my 4yo figured how to to press down hard enough it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: cec

customer_reviews.title: Easy Cherry-Pitting Big Time
customer_reviews.text: Love this kitchen tool for easy depitting of six cherries at a time. The unit does not require extraordinary pressure...very easy pushing down motion with quick removal of pits. The tool is easy to clean. It became an instant hit in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Streeds

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? Before moving to Florida I canned and froze a lot of cherries as I lived in Michigan. I would have loved it back then more than you can imagine. This works so well and I do use it a lot when I can find cherries down here. But it is a good gadget investment!
customer_reviews.author: piglyt

customer_reviews.title: Good product; time saver
customer_reviews.text: It makes peeling cherries easy. Only caveat is that it does not get the pit 100% of the time. I’d say about 90%.
customer_reviews.author: Anaicca

customer_reviews.title: What a timesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: This cherry pitter seriously cut my processing time! Pitting cherries by hand was a 2 hour job for 3 bags of fresh cherries... this product cut the time down to 15 minutes!! It never missed a pit and was easy to use! It's definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jo H.

customer_reviews.title: Very handy tool
customer_reviews.text: Used the pitter today for 1 1/2 # sweet cherries for cobbler. It worked very well, only found 3-4 pits dangling. I tried to place each cherry with the stem end upright, then after the punch, I Counted for 6 pits and if any missing checked the cherries before moving on. The work was done quickly with this handy tool and it is easily cleaned. I can't use the other type due to history of repetitive motion wrist issues so this one is great! Fresh cherries are slightly cheaper than canned type and probably have more vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: DobeLady

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: We use it to pit cherries to put in yogurt.Love it is so fast and no more stained hands!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Elizabeth Kropp

customer_reviews.title: Love this and use it frequently
customer_reviews.text: Love this and use it frequently. Easy to use, and a breeze to clean. Does the job of removing the pits and you can do up to 6 cherries at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Braff

customer_reviews.title: My heart goes “Pitter” patter!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I decided to purchase this one after reading recommendations by ATK. There is another they recommend but it was more expensive so I went with last years winner! I survived 13 quarts of cherries!
customer_reviews.author: DeAnna Coburn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product,easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Was amazed at how easy it was to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: beverly.a.hayden

customer_reviews.title: Best cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing I just drop six cherry's in it and they all fall into the slots before my hand and get on the lever to push the pits out with the plastic pieces being removable clean up was a breeze. We used it to have a sweet treat at the fair no cherry spitting just fun. My favorite part is being able to keep up with the kids eating them while Im pitting and having time to eats some with no screams.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: PICK OF THE LITTER
customer_reviews.text: I've used one at a time pitters as well as the container type. They both get the job done but this one does it better. I just pitted 3 bags of cherries - easy peasy! I'm ready to bake.
customer_reviews.author: Zu Zu's Mom

customer_reviews.title: The first one worked great - everything moved like clockwork
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I purchased. The first one worked great - everything moved like clockwork. The second one I purchased didn't line up quite right and couldn't be opened as easily. In addition, the second one came straight from the factory and wasn't packaged in anything but bubble wrap. Overall, it's a good product, but there needs to be better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Duck

customer_reviews.title: Left some pits intact
customer_reviews.text: Some times the thing leaves pits in it. It’s like they bounce off or something. However you can do a lot of cherries fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jerri  Estep

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for cherry time. So easy to use, clean up and get all the pitted cherries you want.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rister

customer_reviews.title: A better quality and far more efficient with the capability of ...
customer_reviews.text: SOOOO convenient. A better quality and far more efficient with the capability of pitting several cherries at once vs. many other models that just allow one at a time or a couple at best.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was broken. I returned it, and got a replacement. It works very fine and easy. Keep in mind though, you need to remove the stems from the cherries yourself; this device is only for the pits. I bought this one, and the "Progressive Prepworks GPC-5005" at the same time. This one "Progressive Prepworks GPC-5100" works better. In addition, this one removes six at a time, and the other one only four.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Device broke on 3rd batch of 6 cherries.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic cap holding prongs broke on the 3rd batch of 6 cherries. Many of the cherry pits not removed.
customer_reviews.author: James Baum

customer_reviews.title: had one, and got one for gift
customer_reviews.text: Our family liked ours so much that we got another for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: hmm

customer_reviews.title: Works as it supposed to! You should still inspect ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as it supposed to! You should still inspect your cherries to make sure the pit has been expelled. Usually 1 out of 6 has a pit that has been loosened but not expelled.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C. Olliff

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleanup is a plus
customer_reviews.text: The cherry pitter works well, but the white sliding locking mechanism broke off within the first 2 days of use. The cherry pitter does effectively pit six cherries most of the time, yet often the pit is either left hanging or has not been removed at all. Easy cleanup is a plus, but I would not buy this brand for the money, in the future. For a few extra dollars, I would try a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Broke The First Time I Tried To Use It!
customer_reviews.text: I broke the first time I tried to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rae H Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I was so surprised. It worked. Give it a try and enjoy...
customer_reviews.author: Ona Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver
customer_reviews.text: Made the job of pitting the huge bag of cherries off our tree so much easier!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Heller

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with my hands so I didn't think I could use a conventional pitter so I purchased this one and I am very pleased with my purchase. I just pitted 8 pounds of cherries (.97 a pound on sale) in about 30 minutes with great ease. I froze them in a single layer on a cookie sheet and now I will be able to enjoy them at a fraction of a cost of purchasing frozen cherries from the store. This really is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive cherry pitter for light work. Easy to use. Easy to clean...seems durable. I would recommend this if you want to make a cherry pie ..... one or two pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: M. O.

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product very easy to use, I can pit enough cherry’s for a pie in less than ten minutes
customer_reviews.author: Manny Sousa

customer_reviews.title: will work great for the cherries I pick from my trees
customer_reviews.text: will work great for the cherries I pick from my trees. purchased the trees for decoration. this will help with enjoying my decoration a bit more. bring the summer home for the holidays
customer_reviews.author: gayle grant brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddlers, a pain to clean
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for my toddler who was finally able to eat cherries independently! Cleaning is a pain though. You need a small brush to get into the grooves — I wish it came with one
customer_reviews.author: Su

customer_reviews.title: Better than doing by hand!
customer_reviews.text: Does push the pits out of the cherries, but most of them are still on the cherry and you have to manully pull them off. Other than that, it does beat taking the pits out by hand!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Hines

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Very effective and durable. It's difficult to clean but as long as you rinse and wash it immediately after use it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with how this works. For me, it is easier to only put 4 cherries in at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S

customer_reviews.title: Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my mother in law. Personally, I would never use this for everyday if I were just eating cherries. However, I can see how it would come in handy if needing to pit cherries for a pie or baking needs. It pits the cherries everytime. I thought the plastic would be flimsy but it's pretty sturdy. East to wash and manage.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha

customer_reviews.title: Fast work of pitting 🍒
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great , now I can eat cherries 6 times faster.
customer_reviews.author: sandibeaches5

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate...buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea that I even needed this but now I can't live without it! I made Cherries Jubilee for my husband. I was always too lazy to do this because I didn't want to fight with de-pitting the cherries. This makes it fun.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Best product we've purchased so far this year
customer_reviews.text: Best product we've purchased so far this year. Works amazingly well. Quick and easy and painless and doesn't leave a mess. I cracked a tooth on a cherry pit last year, and this product will assure that I don't do that again. WE LOVE IT!!!

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have always feared of cracking a tooth on a pit again!! Love it Love it

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cherry pitter! I received it Friday and in the same day pitted 22 pounds of cherries! I love it! It was an easy tool to use and my kids were able to safely help out as well! Great price! Great seller!

product_meta.title: Prepworks by Progressive Cherry Pitter Cherry Pitter Stoner Seed and Olive Tool Remover
product_meta.description:
Pit up to six cherries with a single motion using this progressive prep works cherry pitter. With zinc alloy blades, this pitter features a red color. Counters and hands stay mess-free while the removable container catches pits and juice. The non-skid base keeps the pitter stable while zinc prongs push pits through. The cherry pitter disassembles for cleaning and locks tightly for storage. Dishwasher safe, this cherry pitter makes clean up a breeze. Pits up to 6 cherries.

For over 40 years, our mission has been to create innovative kitchen tools and gadgets that make food preparation fun and fast while inspiring culinary creativity. From our thinstore™ collapsibles to our sophisticated PL8™ line, our dedication to providing quality products supported by superior customer service continues to drive our creative development today.

At Progressive International, we continually strive to understand the needs of today’s cooks. Our team includes talented, energetic and passionate people committed to reimagining the kitchen. We strive to pass our passion on to our consumers through our thoughtfully designed tools, layered with our avid desire to go beyond the expected. 

Our philosophy is simple: offer stylish designs complimented by no-nonsense functionality. We understand the kitchen is the heart of the home, where families and friends connect. Our ongoing mission is to provide exceptional kitchen essentials that help cooks of all skill levels create meals worth sharing.

Prep Solutions, Prepworks and PL8 continues to build on the Progressive; legacy by offering products that make food prep faster, easier and more enjoyable.
feature_bullets: MESS-FREE: Your kitchen counters and hands stay Mess-Free with the removable base that catches pits and juice
DISHWASHER SAFE FOR CONVENIENT CLEANING: The pitter disassembles for easy cleaning and locks tightly for storage
PATENTED DESIGN: This product is patented and measures 8"L x 4.25" W
SIMPLE TO USE: Easily Press Down with little effort to quickly pit up to 6 cherries at once
SAFE AND DURABLE: The Non-Skid base keeps the pitter stable while the zinc prongs push pits through
